channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12771] TestFailFast#testFastFail failing
item.description:
Fails on our internal rig and from time to time on apache. Here is latest:


org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFastFail.testFastFail

Failing for the past 1 build (Since Failed#654 )

Took 7.1 sec.

Error Message



Only few thread should ideally be waiting for the dead regionserver to be coming back. numBlockedWorkers:155 threads that retried : 10



Stacktrace



java.lang.AssertionError: Only few thread should ideally be waiting for the dead regionserver to be coming back. numBlockedWorkers:155 threads that retried : 10

	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFastFail.testFastFail(TestFastFail.java:270)

Opening this issue so can start tracking the fails. Looking in log, nothing obvious. Will be back to this one.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Another fail, same place:


Regression



org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFastFail.testFastFail

Failing for the past 1 build (Since Failed#626 )

Took 5.9 sec.

Error Message



Only few thread should ideally be waiting for the dead regionserver to be coming back. numBlockedWorkers:31 threads that retried : 2



Stacktrace



java.lang.AssertionError: Only few thread should ideally be waiting for the dead regionserver to be coming back. numBlockedWorkers:31 threads that retried : 2

	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFastFail.testFastFail(TestFastFail.java:270)

Any input on this Manukranth Kolloju? Thanks boss.

It also fails here: https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/HBase-1.0/612/testReport/junit/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client/TestFastFail/testFastFail/


Error Message



There should be atleast one PreemptiveFastFail exception, otherwise, the test makes little sense.numPreemptiveFastFailExceptions: 0

Stacktrace



java.lang.AssertionError: There should be atleast one PreemptiveFastFail exception, otherwise, the test makes little sense.numPreemptiveFastFailExceptions: 0

	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFastFail.testFastFail(TestFastFail.java:264)
stack, let me take a look and see why its failing.

While testing for FastFail, I was randomly picking and killing the META server and didn't account for the extra latencies that it would add. This was causing the test to fail in branch 1. Seems like the region map relearning when META goes down is faster in trunk than in branch 1. As a result, the test was never failing in trunk but somehow failing in branch 1. Anyone knows why killing META server is adding about an extra PAUSE_TIME worth delay in RegionServerCallable.prepare ?
Because there is no rpc in trunk? The meta is colocated on the master and we by-pass rpc? Could that be it Manukranth Kolloju?

Currently, by killing a regionserver other than META seems to be behaving properly. The test ran about 100 times and passed all the times, so the fix seems to have brought back the trunk behavior.
Here the request is being made from a client in the unit test, so, I am not sure what would be significantly different just because the META is colocated with the master. I will spend some more time to understand why we are seeing unnecessary sleeps in branch 1 during meta lookup, but the test failures can be explained purely by the extra delays which I did not account for in the test.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12690218/HBASE-12771-v1.patch
against master branch at commit 7774f964e62842806d849cae1a6af830c137d737.

Lets try it Manukranth Kolloju. Patch looks good. Thank you for taking a looksee. I'll leave the issue open a while. Will close later if this seems to have fixed it. Would be interesting if 1.0 branch is doing something dumb populating its local region map. Pushed to branch-1 and branch-1.0.
